name: Path T Corpus Adenosarcoma
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  Assign 88 for in situ cases (behavior code /2). TNM nor FIGO  include an in situ category for sarcomas of the corpus.

**Note 2:**  When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and extension information on the primary tumor are available, use the extension information to assign the T in preference to a statement of FIGO stage - see Registrar notes.
* If the only information is (pathologic) FIGO IIIC, assign the appropriate stage and leave pathologic T, N, and M blank. If the only information is (pathologic) FIGO stage IVB, leave pathologic T and N blank and see M

**Note 3:** Extension to the bowel or bladder mucosa must be proven by biopsy in order to rule out bullous edema.
footnotes:
\* TX is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use the standard definition "Primary tumor cannot be assessed," as TX.
\** T0 is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use the standard definition "No evidence of primary tumor," as T0.
rows:
Primary tumor cannot be assessed 

Pathologic classification criteria met, evaluation done:
     Physician unable to assess T
     Surgical resection of primary tumor, extension not stated
 Physician assigns cTX, no other information available to determine T

Note: T1 has subcategories of T1a, T1b and T1c. Assign T1 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories.

Invasive cancer confined to corpus uteri 

Invasion of myometrium, NOS WITH or WITHOUT involvement of endocervix

Tunica serosa of the visceral peritoneum (serosa covering the corpus)

Cervix uteri, NOS, but not beyond uterus

Localized, NOS

FIGO Stage I [NOS]

Stated as T1 [NOS]

Confined to endometrium OR endocervix (Glandular, stromal or both)

FIGO Stage IA

Stated as T1
Tumor invades less than half of the myometrium

Tumor invades less than one-half of myometrium WITH involvement of endocervix

FIGO Stage IB

Stated as T1b
Tumor invades one half or more of the myometrium

Invasion of outer half of myometrium WITH involvement of endocervix

FIGO Stage IC

Stated as T1c
Tumor extends beyond the uterus, within the pelvis

Note: T2 has subcategories of T2a and T2b. Assign T2 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories.

FIGO Stage II [NOS]

Stated as T2 [NOS]

Adnexal involvement, NOS
Extension or metastasis within true pelvis:
    Adnexa
    Fallopian tube(s)
    Ligaments:
        Broad
        Round
        Uterosacral
    Ovary(ies)
    Parametrium
    Visceral peritoneum of pelvic organs excluding serosa of corpus uteri

FIGO Stage IIA

Stated as T2a

Extension or metastasis to:
    Cul de sac (rectouterine pouch)
    Pelvic wall(s)
    Parietal serosa of pelvic cavity
    Ureter
    Vagina
    Vulva

Described clinically as "frozen pelvis", NOS

FIGO Stage IIB

Stated as T2b

Note: T3 has subcategories of T3a and T3b. Assign T3 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories.

Abdominal tissues involvement, NOS

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T3 [NOS]

Infiltration of abdominal tissues, one of the following sites:
    Abdominal serosa (visceral or parietal peritoneum of abdomen)
    Sigmoid colon
    Small intestine
    Other abdominal structures

FIGO Stage IIIA

Stated as T3a

FIGO Stage IIIB

Stated as T3b
Tumor invades bladder or rectal mucosa

Invasion of:
    Bladder wall
    Bladder, NOS excluding mucosa
    Rectal wall
    Rectum, NOS excluding mucosa

Extension to bowel mucosa or bladder (excluding bullous edema)

FIGO Stage IVA

Stated as T4

In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM
Death certificate only (DCO) case

Only information is FIGO Stage III [NOS], IIIC, or  IVB

Pathologic classification not met
Pathologic classification criteria met, evaluation done:
    Results not documented in patient record
    No surgical resection of known primary tumor (not T0) OR
    Resection insufficient for site-specific pathologic assessment
No surgical resection of primary tumor and there isn't a positive biopsy of a structure in the highest T category and highest N category
Evidence of metastatic disease (pM1), no other workup
